I haven't updated for too long, but I just couldn't think of anything to update about. So now that I have, here you go. I sat and thought the other day how it seems strange that we can walk through life so blind and how a lot of people never change. I've been thinking about all sorts of things lately. Seeing as how my birthday is next week, my mind has been on my past and my future. In two years I'll be turning thirty. I honestly never thought I'd make it this far. But I'm glad I have, and I'm happy with where my life is going. And I'm happy with where it is right now. I've managed to maintain a steady marriage for over a year, I'm in a successful band, I've got good, strong friendships, and my wife has a baby on the way. It took me a long time to get where I am right now, and I really hope it stays this way. I do have reason to believe it won't, but I need to think positively. Or else things will go crashing down, like always. It's nice to have a fresh start with old friends. And to hear them say things that used to make you happy, and have them still make you happy. Well this post really didn't turn out any good so I'm going to quit rambling and go find some food.

She kept one of them next to her the whole time and I asked her who it was for. "It's for Maggie, Daddy!" After a long, akward silence, and quite the angry stare from Denice, I went in the kitchen and got drinks for everyone. When I came back Dee and Angie were talking and Kid was helping Starla with the Easy Bake Oven he got her. After a while Angie said she had to get going, but she would let Starla stay until after her birthday. I decided I'll take her out one day just to have a day to ourselves for our birthdays. I'm planning on having a party at my house. Everyone's invited so I hope to see everyone there<s>not that anyone will show up</s>. IM me if you have any questions. I really wonder at times what's going on in my head and what causes me to be so stupid at times. I nearly lost the best friendship I have ever had and probably will ever have. I did something so horribly cruel, and I would take it back so very fast if I could. Well, maybe I wouldn't take back the action, but I would prevent the pain. Seeing him so angry, so hurt, so disappointed was more guilt than I could handle. I grabbed my keys and said "I'm outta here" and as I was headed towards the door, he ran out yelling "Fuck you" as he went. I followed him out the door only to see the rear end of his car as his tires squealed and he soon disappeared down the street. I just calmly got into my car and headed toward the park. I told everyone I was headed for Indiana to see my mom. I only said that to make sure no one found me. I spent the day on a park bench crying until I literally couldn't anymore. I must've been quite a sight to see. Some time around 5pm, he called my cell phone begging me to come home and to keep him from driving his car off the end of the pier. I just said no and hung up. He of course called me back and said "Don't hang up on me again." I decided to hear him out and listen to what he had to say. "Kris, I don't care about what you did anymore. I realize that you are far more important to me than some relationship in the past that doesn't even mean a thing to me now. I need my best friend. Please come home." "Kid, I already am home." "You're in California?" "No, Indiana. Home." His hopes fell when I said that, and although he didn't make a sound, I could just tell. It was like I felt his heart sink when I said that, because mine did too. Eventually, he got so upset that he had a massive asthma attack and said "Kris...come...come home n...now." I knew at that very moment that he needed me and that I needed him, so I threw the fight aside and said I'd fly home. Of course I had to wait long enough to make it believeable that I had actually been in Indiana. I got there and found his room. The second he saw me, I saw in his eyes that everything really would be okay. Things were still rough after he got out. I was still upset and I didn't trust completely that he was my friend. That was such a horrible feeling. Something I never want to feel again. The next day, I walked up to him and said "Kid" and he said "Yes?" I walked up to him and gave him a huge hug and said "I am so sorry and I promise I will never do that again. I am so lucky to be your best friend." All the while I never let go. He told me the same thing and said he was sorry. I leaned over and whispered "I got my best friend back." He said he got his back. I told him that his best friend was the luckiest person ever, but also very stupid. "Don't say things like that about him, he's a great guy and I love him." was all he said to that. Hearing that was so wonderful. It melted away all the pain and guilt lingering and let me be happy. I have been in the greatest mood ever since. I am seriously so incredibly lucky that he even talks to me still. Kid, I am so happy we're still best friends and please don't ever let me be so dumb again. I wouldn't be able to take it. You are one of the best people I know, and I never want to lose you. See you tomorrow. Can't wait to give you your Christmas gifts. Love ya, man.

Happy Thanksgiving, everyone. I hope you all had an enjoyable day. I did. My day was spent with my wife, my band, and a family member or three thrown in there. It was very delicious. Denice is getting really good at making vegetarian Thanksgiving dinners. 

Anyways, I haven't been online much in the past two days. I've been busy helping get ready for today. And hanging out with my best friend. He said he's found someone new. Which couldn't make me happier. I gave her "the test" and she passed with flying colors. I really hope she makes him happy if they end up together. I don't want to see him get hurt like he did ever again. But I'm not expecting him to this time. The good thing is, is that I don't have to worry about that.

I really don't want to be in this stupid place anymore. I'm homesick and being here isn't making anything better. I feel just fine, but the doctors won't let me leave. I want out, someone rescue me. 


<small>I'll do anything...</small>

I'm sure you've all heard by now, I'm in the hospital. Kid and I were talking, and the last thing I remember was getting really upset and not being able to breathe. Then I passed out. The doctors still aren't positive as to what caused it. When I came to, Kid, along with some EMTs, was standing over me. Kid was sobbing and begging me to wake up and be okay. I grabbed his hand and asked what was going on. He told me what happened on the way to the hospital. I've been here ever since. Everyone is worrying about me, and I don't want them to. I'll be fine, I just passed out. Nothing more. I just want him to be okay. That's all that matters to me right now. I don't care one bit about myself right now. I feel fine and I just want to get home and make sure Kid is going to be okay. <small>Can I just grab him and leave right now?</small>

I'm at my house with Kid right now. We were in his hotel room talking and all of sudden his cell rang. His sister called to tell him that their dad had a massive heart attack. I could tell something was horribly wrong by the tone in his voice. "Kris...my dad had a massive heart attack." My heart sank right to the floor when he said that. He told me he was flying home right away, and I told him I had to go with him. I couldn't let him go anywhere alone in his condition. I was practically carrying him out to the car because he was such a mess. We kept stopping on the way to the car so he could calm himself a little. One time I just hugged him and didn't let go for a few minutes. But then he started digging through his pockets to find his sister's cell number. While I was holding his cell, his mom called, so I answered. She called to tell him that his dad passed away. He leaned against the car and told me something horrible. He told me that he was going to try to make things right with his dad and that he was going to apologize. They had been fighting because, while drunk, his dad gave Kid's condo away because "the tenant was never home". He told me it couldn't be real. He wouldn't believe it. As much as I didn't want to, I told him it was real, and he had to believe it. We finally got in the car and started down the road. About 5 minutes later, Kid told me to pull over. As soon as I got stopped, he got out and just started throwing up. After that, he sat on the ground and leaned against the side of the car crying. I got out and just sat next to him. I didn't know his dad, but I cried with him. Seeing him in such bad shape was heartwrenching. I couldn't bear to see him that way. From then on is pretty much a blur. I pulled the futon into his room so that if he needs anything during the night, he doesn't have to walk all the way to my room to get me. Well, I better get going. It's been a long day and I'm exhausted.

Aaron and Aly's wedding was absolutely beautiful. They both looked great. Aaron looked so happy it was frightening. I hope someone got a picture of his face! Aly looked very pretty. Her dress was nice and it fit her personality. I don't know how a dress can fit someone's personality, but you get the point. After that we went to the reception. Lots of drinking. I don't know why I drank. I have a the flu right now and that was the worst thing I could've done. Kid and I got so drunk. Since Aly was sick we went to the hotel and partied there. That was fun. It was better because then we didn't have to go far to get to our rooms. When we were getting ready to leave, I gave Aaron and Aly the presents Dee, Kid and I got them. They loved them. We were happy. After that we all went to bed. I felt so horrible when I woke up this morning. I didn't look any better either. I haven't left the bathroom all day. I'm even laying on the floor typing this right now. I need to go to the doctor and make sure I'm not really super sick. I'm getting nauseated again so I'm going to lay back down.

Wow, two of my best friends are getting married. One of them tomorrow in Las Vegas, and I don't know when the other is getting married. I'm on my way to the airport with Kid right now. We're going to Vegas for Aaron's wedding. I'm working on getting Denice a ticket to Vegas, but it's hard when she's all the way across the country from me. When I pick her up from the airport tomorrow, I'm going to take her and Kid to the mall so we can all find something to wear. This is so exciting. It's not everyday you find out that TWO of your friends are getting married. I wish you guys and you guys the best of luck!
